sentences: Ta oli peol koos oma kihlatuga.
Maria ja tema kihlatud armastavad teineteist väga.
Kihlatud olemine tõi nende suhtesse uusi vastutustundeid.
context: The word 'kihlatud' in Estonian refers to a person who is engaged or betrothed, specifically referring to the fiancé/fiancée. It's the past participle form of the verb 'kihkuda' (to be/become engaged). In the example sentence 'Ta oli peol koos oma kihlatuga,' it means he/she was at the party with their fiancé/fiancée. The word can refer to either a male or female fiancé depending on context, similar to how English uses separate terms.
